title: At Jackie Robinson's high school, a fire-ravaged city rebuilds
content: After 1 in 4 students lost their homes or were displaced by the Eaton fire, their school held them together.

title: Suarez, managers suspended for Padres-L.A. feud
content: Major League Baseball has suspended Padres reliever Robert Suarez for three games (pending appeal) and managers Mike Shildt and Dave Roberts for one each, the aftermath of a feud between the teams that boiled over Thursday night in L.A.

title: Devers, facing Boston, clarifies first base mindset
content: New Giants slugger Rafael Devers, while still shying away from discussing his past relationship with the Red Sox, did provide some insight Friday into why he is willing to play first base in San Francisco after refusing to do so in Boston.

title: Pirates' Santana gets 4 games for swiping at fan
content: Pirates reliever Dennis Santana, who leaped and swiped at a fan during Thursday's game against the Tigers, has been suspended four games and fined an undisclosed amount.

title: Raleigh hits 2 HRs for 29, breaks Bench's record
content: Cal Raleigh broke Johnny Bench's record for home runs by a catcher before the All-Star break, hitting his major-league-leading 28th and 29th in the Mariners' 9-4 victory over the Cubs on Friday.

title: Dodgers donate $1M to families affected by raids
content: The Dodgers have donated $1 million to assist families impacted by two weeks of immigration raids in Southern California.

title: Wisconsin sues Miami for tampering with transfer
content: The University of Wisconsin filed a lawsuit Friday claiming Miami's football team broke the law by tampering with a Badgers player.

title: Canelo-Crawford winner can earn knockout bonus
content: Turki Alalshikh says the winner of September's showdown between pound-for-pound greats Canelo Alvarez and Terence Crawford will receive a bonus if either fighter ends the affair by knockout.

title: Senegal women's hoops team denied U.S. visas
content: The prime minister of Senegal said the women's basketball team has canceled plans to train in the U.S. after visa applications of five players and seven officials were not approved.

title: Rankings of MLB starters, relievers and their arsenal of pitches over the past three seasons
content: A stat rooted in Game Theory reveals who's maximizing their arsenals, and who's leaving outs on the table.

title: Power Rankings: Can anyone unseat the Tigers at No. 1?
content: With a third week in a row atop our list, Detroit is the team with the most consecutive weeks at No. 1 in 2025.

title: Flamengo stun Chelsea in another big Club World Cup upset
content: Chelsea's tournament chances took a serious hit as they were outclassed and outplayed by Flamengo in Philadelphia. Here's what you need to know from Friday in the Club World Cup.

title: The USMNT is a mess. That's the price of the U.S. becoming a 'soccer country'
content: The more the U.S. cares about soccer and produces better players, the more dysfunctional the USMNT becomes. That's just how it is.

title: Richards saves the day for the USMNT on a night when the front line couldn't
content: The United States has advanced at the Gold Cup, but the performances from the attacking players must improve.

title: 'Not a Cinderella story': Coastal Carolina's rise as a college baseball power
content: Riding a 26-game win streak, the Chanticleers are on the cusp of a second national title in 10 years.

title: 'Absolutely botched': How the Red Sox-Devers breakup got so messy
content: As Devers prepares to play against his former team, a look inside the clubhouse culture that helped cause the divorce.

title: 'The Lakers can finally be run like a real business': Leaguewide reaction to the stunning sale
content: The Lakers have spent decades lagging behind other NBA teams in ways known -- and not. This sale presents a massive opportunity for them to catch up -- and expedite their chase for title No. 18.

title: 'He can do anything': Why Liverpool spent big to sign Wirtz
content: Liverpool have broken their transfer record to sign Florian Wirtz from Bayer Leverkusen for an initial £100m, but what is so special about him?

title: Lamine Yamal links up with Neymar in Brazil
content: Barcelona's teenage star Lamine Yamal has finally had the opportunity to get to know his "idol" Neymar as he holidays in Brazil during the off-season.

title: Durant buys minority stake in soccer club PSG
content: Phoenix Suns forward Kevin Durant has purchased a minority stake in Champions League winner Paris Saint-Germain, the Ligue 1 club said Friday.

title: South Korea lifts 26-year ban on foreign GKs
content: A 26-year ban on foreign goalkeepers in South Korea's top flight has been lifted for the start of the 2026 season.

title: Salah, Fernandes up for PFA Player of the Year
content: Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah and Manchester United's Bruno Fernandes have been shortlisted for the 2024-25 Men's PFA Player of the Year award.

title: Poch hails 'humble' Richards, expects decisive play
content: United States manager Mauricio Pochettino hailed the performance of center-back Chris Richards, who delivered at both ends of the field in the American's1-0 win over Saudi Arabia in the Gold Cup.

title: Brazil's Botafogo upset UCL champs PSG at CWC
content: Igor Jesus scored a first-half goal, leading Botafogo to a stunning 1-0 win over the reigning European champions Paris Saint-Germain in the Club World Cup on Thursday in Pasadena, California.

title: Diamonds in the rough: Late-round gems of the 2025 NHL draft
content: These seven players are unlikely to be first-rounders, but all have a path to NHL success down the road.

title: Who are the best players in the 2026 NFL draft class? We picked the top five at every position
content: Matt Miller and Jordan Reid stack their early top-fives at every position and break down the players they'll be watching during the 2025 season.

title: PLL Week 4 preview: What to watch at Whipsnakes' homecoming
content: The action heads to Baltimore this weekend. Check here for the full schedule, key stats, injury notes, more.

title: MLB mock draft 2.0: Kiley McDaniel predicts the first 40 picks
content: The Men's College World Series is bringing the top of next month's draft into better focus, starting with a new No. 1 pick.

title: Hill or Rountree: Which fighter has the best UFC knockout?
content: Two of elite knockout artists in the UFC's light heavyweight division will square off in the main event at UFC Fight Night, but which fighter has the best KO victory?

title: Barnwell picks the NFL's top luxuries: The best players at 11 specialized roles
content: Gadget player, slot cornerback, swing tackle, backup quarterback -- these players are the best at their very specific roles.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal, Chelsea eye Milan's Leão
content: AC Milan are willing to listen to offers for Rafael Leão. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Fantasy football: Values for CMC, Tyreek and more top storylines for 2025
content: Mike Clay, Daniel Dopp and Field Yates enjoy a robust conversation about the topics that fascinate them most heading into this fantasy season.

title: Rematch review -- a soccer game that's brilliant even if you don't like the sport
content: Sloclap's soccer simulation pares the beautiful game down to the essentials -- and it's a blast to play.

title: Pak nominates Trump for Nobel Peace Prize; cites role in India-Pakistan crisis
content: Pakistan has nominated Donald Trump for the 2026 Nobel Peace Prize, citing his role in de-escalating tensions between India and Pakistan. Trump himself has claimed he deserves the award for multiple peace efforts, including preventing a war between the two nuclear-armed nations. He also announced a peace treaty between the Democratic Republic of the Congo and Rwanda.

title: Historic! Praggnanandhaa surpasses world champion Gukesh in world rankings
content: R Praggnanandhaa has surpassed D Gukesh in live FIDE rankings, reaching a rating of 2777.2 while competing in the UzChess Cup Masters. He is currently tied for the lead in the tournament after defeating Shamsiddin Vokhidov. Recently, India saw four players in the global top 10, including Aravindh Chithambaram, highlighting the country's growing dominance in chess.

title: India’s gone from despair to optimism in 11 yrs: Home minister Amit Shah
content: Home minister Amit Shah has asserted that the Modi govt, in its 11 years, has ensured unprecedented development and managed to swing the country's mood from despair to optimism through a series of policy and welfare measures. In a 90-minute conversation. with TOI, Shah said the all-pervasive mood over corruption and stagnation, insecurity on both external and internal fronts, and apprehension among the youth formed the legacy UPA bequeathed to the Modi govt in 2014. “I consider the renewal of hope and confidence about the country's future a significant achievement,” he added

title: Amazon's ultimatum: Company tells employees to choose - 30 days to ... or resign in 60 days
content: Amazon is requiring numerous corporate employees to relocate to major hubs like Seattle and Arlington, creating anxiety amidst job insecurity and AI-driven workforce reductions. Affected employees face short deadlines to decide, with no severance offered for those who resign instead of moving. This relocation push intensifies Amazon's in-office requirements and aligns with warnings of upcoming AI-related layoffs.

title: 'Who will be 3rd centurion?' Tendulkar recalls 2002 Test after Day 1 domination
content: Sachin Tendulkar recalls India's 2002 Headingley win. He connects it to the current team's strong start. Shubman Gill and Yashasvi Jaiswal scored centuries. Tendulkar, Rahul Dravid, and Sourav Ganguly had centuries in 2002. India amassed a huge total then. Gill and Jaiswal's partnership is promising. Rishabh Pant also contributed well. Fans are eager to see if India can repeat history.

title: Operation Sindhu: Third rescue flight carrying Indians lands in Delhi
content: Amidst escalating tensions between Israel and Iran, the Indian government initiated Operation Sindhu, safely evacuating Indian nationals from the Middle East. A flight carrying 290 students, mainly from Jammu and Kashmir, landed in Delhi from Mashhad, Iran, after Tehran opened its airspace. Approximately 1,000 Indians are expected to return, with additional flights scheduled.

title: 88.16m! Neeraj Chopra clinches first DL victory in 2 years - Watch throw here
content: Neeraj Chopra clinched his first Diamond League victory in two years in Paris, triumphing over Germany's Julian Weber with an impressive 88.16m throw. This win marks Chopra's first in the Paris leg of the series, overcoming previous second-place finishes. Earlier, Chopra finished second to Weber at the Doha Diamond League.

title: When Steve Jobs gifted brand new Jaguar to secretary after he got late to office
content: Steve Jobs, known for his demanding leadership, once gifted a late secretary a Jaguar to prevent future tardiness, showcasing his paradoxical nature of being both intimidating and inspiring. Ron Givens, Apple's former quality director, shared anecdotes of Jobs' unexpected generosity and relentless pursuit of excellence. Jobs' high expectations extended to late-night calls, as recalled by Pixar's Pete Docter.

title: From Tendulkar-Sehwag to Gill-Jaiswal! Day 1 of Leeds Test rewrites history books
content: Shubman Gill and Yashasvi Jaiswal's centuries powered India to a dominant 359 for 3 on Day 1 against England at Headingley. Gill's unbeaten 127, his first outside Asia, and Jaiswal's 101, the first by an Asian opener at the ground, highlighted India's strong start. Rishabh Pant's aggressive 65* further solidified India's imposing position in the opening Test.

title: Aamir Khan starrer 'Sitaare Zameen Par' takes the reins by minting Rs.11.7 cr
content: Aamir Khan's 'Sitaare Zameen Par,' also starring Genelia D’Souza, premiered on June 20th to positive reception, earning Rs. 11.7 crore on its opening day, surpassing 'Taare Zameen Par'. The film's Hindi version led earnings, impacting 'Housefull 5's' box office performance. The plot centers on a basketball coach's community service, training players with intellectual disabilities for a national tournament.

title: Dhanush-Nagarjuna thriller 'Kuberaa' opens with Rs 13 cr; dominates market
content: Dhanush and Nagarjuna's thriller 'Kuberaa' has made a strong debut, earning an impressive Rs 13 crore net in India on its opening day. The Telugu version is leading the charge with remarkable occupancy rates in Andhra Pradesh and Telangana, especially during night shows. While the Tamil version showed fair occupancy, particularly in Chennai during evening shows, the film's performance was limited in Kannada, Hindi, and Malayalam.

title: AI is your intern today: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman to software engineers; but soon …
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman envisions AI evolving from an 'intern' to a seasoned software engineer, potentially revolutionizing coding roles. He anticipates AI agents tackling complex business problems and discovering new knowledge soon. While this shift demands software engineers focus on AI management and innovation, concerns arise about AI's impact on employment, with predictions of significant job displacement in white-collar sectors.

title: SC lawyers' body asks ED to respect independence of Bar, exercise restraint
content: The Enforcement Directorate's summons to senior advocates Datar and Venugopal drew strong condemnation from legal bodies like the SC Bar Association and SCAORA. They argued the summonses undermine the independence of the bar and attorney-client privilege protected by the Bharatiya Sakshya Adhiniyam, 2023. Concerns were raised about a chilling effect on legal professionals providing honest opinions.

title: HAL 1st Indian firm to bag full rocket tech
content: Hindustan Aeronautics Ltd. (HAL) has become the first Indian firm to fully acquire the technology for ISRO's Small Satellite Launch Vehicle (SSLV) for Rs 511 crore. IN-SPACe announced this complete transfer of technology as a significant milestone, enabling HAL to independently own, build, market, and launch the rocket after an initial two-year period of assistance from ISRO.

title: Refused Trump invite as I had to visit land of Jagannath: PM Modi
content: PM Modi declined US President Trump's invitation to visit Washington, prioritizing his trip to Odisha for the celebration of the Mohan Charan Majhi-led BJP government's first anniversary. Modi emphasized Odisha's cultural and economic importance, highlighting the government's commitment to infrastructure, healthcare, and tribal community development.

title: Autowallah returns Rs 17 lakh to man who left it behind in 3-wheeler
content: In Lawngtlai, Mizoram, auto-rickshaw driver Lalhmingmuana displayed remarkable honesty by returning Rs 17 lakh to a Myanmar businessman who accidentally left the cash in his vehicle. The businessman, upon realizing his loss, frantically searched for the money. Lalhmingmuana, expecting nothing in return, promptly returned to the hotel to hand over the misplaced sum, earning praise for his integrity.

title: Election Commission allows post-result mock polls to check EVM integrity
content: The Election Commission has revised EVM checking procedures, allowing second or third-place candidates to request mock polls on selected units. Charges are split into two slabs: ₹23,600 for plain checks and ₹47,200 for checks with mock polls. Additionally, the EC has limited the retention period for election-related still and video records to 45 days to prevent misuse.

title: ‘Great day for Africa’: Trump administration brokers Congo-Rwanda treaty
content: Donald Trump announced a peace agreement between the Democratic Republic of the Congo and Rwanda, brokered with Secretary of State Marco Rubio, aiming to end a long-standing conflict. The deal, initiated at the DRC's request, involves halting hostilities and disarming rebel groups.

title: 'Disturbing': Putin on World War III risk; flags concern over Israel-Iran conflict
content: Vladimir Putin expressed concern about the increasing risk of a global conflict. He cited the Russia-Ukraine war and Israel-Iran tensions. Putin highlighted developments around Iranian nuclear facilities. Russia plans to expand military cooperation with friendly countries. This includes joint weapon production and personnel training. Moscow aims to modernise its armed forces. Putin offered to mediate between Iran and Israel.

title: ICICI sought to acquire HDFC, reveals chairman Deepak Parekh
content: Deepak Parekh disclosed that Chanda Kochhar once suggested a merger between ICICI Bank and HDFC. Parekh declined the offer. He cited regulatory pressure as the main driver for HDFC's eventual merger with HDFC Bank. Parekh described the merger's conclusion as both sad and happy. He emphasized the need for larger Indian banks through acquisitions.

title: Mahmoud Khalil case: Federal judge orders release of pro-Palestinian activist
content: A federal judge has ordered the release of Mahmoud Khalil, a former Columbia University graduate student, from immigration detention after over three months. Khalil's detention stemmed from his alleged involvement in pro-Palestinian protests, sparking controversy and accusations of false information on his green card application.

title: Trump gives Iran 'maximum two weeks' for decision; rules out European mediation
content: President Trump has given Iran a maximum of two weeks to avoid potential US airstrikes, suggesting action could come sooner than previously indicated. He downplayed European diplomatic efforts, asserting Iran prefers direct talks with the US.

title: Karnataka moots 7-yr jail for fake news, 2-5 yrs for misinformation
content: Karnataka's government is set to establish a social-media regulatory authority to combat fake news and misinformation. The proposed bill, carrying penalties up to seven years in prison and hefty fines, targets content insulting to women, disrespecting Sanatana Dharma, or promoting superstition. Special courts will be formed to address violations, ensuring accountability from companies and individuals involved in spreading misinformation.

title: Judge halts Trump bid to limit Harvard's international student intake
content: A U.S. federal judge in Boston has temporarily blocked the Trump administration's attempt to restrict Harvard University's international student enrollment. This decision protects the university's ability to host its 7,000 international students amid ongoing legal battles.

title: Cash-at-home case: Amit Shah first to be told about cash at judge Varma's home
content: A fire at Justice Yashwant Varma's residence led to a surprising discovery. Police found half-burnt cash sacks. Delhi Police commissioner Sanjay Arora informed Home Minister Amit Shah. He also briefed Delhi HC Chief Justice D K Upadhyay. The Chief Justice then informed CJI Sanjiv Khanna. An inquiry was initiated. Videos and images were authenticated. Witnesses corroborated the evidence.

title: SUV collides with truck, 2 brothers among 9 killed
content: In a tragic incident on NH-18 in Purulia, West Bengal, nine people from Jharkhand, including two brothers, died when their SUV collided head-on with a truck while returning from a wedding. The impact of the collision was severe, resulting in the SUV being mangled and all passengers declared dead at a nearby health center.

title: ‘Mayday’: Guwahati-Chennai flight aborts landing, runs thin on fuel
content: The pilot of IndiGo flight 6E-6764 (A321), which took off from Guwahati at 4.40pm, attempted to land at Chennai around 7.45pm, but decided to ‘go around’ after the landing gear touched the runway in a procedure called ‘balked landing’.

title: IND vs ENG: From battling cramps to off-side masterclass - Yashasvi Jaiswal stamps authority at Headingley
content: If the century in Perth was an announcement of his arrival away from home, the Headingley knock was a reminder of his class against an opposition Yashasvi has enjoyed a lot of success against. When he gets in, he makes the opposition pay and his four hundreds - 161, 214*, 209 and 171 - in the format and more in the First-Class circuit have been big, and rarely has he thrown his wicket after getting his eye in.

title: Maharashtra man, 83, loses Rs 1.2 crore to fake stock trading portal
content: An 83-year-old retiree from Dadar fell victim to an elaborate online stock trading scam, losing Rs 1.2 crore. The retiree was lured through a fake platform disguised as a reputable financial institution after clicking on an online advertisement. Cyber police are currently investigating the fraud, tracing IP addresses and financial transactions to identify the perpetrators.

title: Pharmacist fudges autopsy report
content: In a shocking case of alleged honor killing in UP's Sambhal, a pharmacist has been suspended for accepting a bribe to manipulate the autopsy report of a 17-year-old girl. The pharmacist altered the cause of death to "hanging" instead of "strangulation" to protect the girl's father and brother, who are accused of murdering her for her relationship.

title: Life hit in Manipur district as tribal outfit enforces shutdown over woman's death in crossfire
content: An indefinite shutdown gripped Churachandpur, while Kangpokpi observed a 24-hour closure following the death of a tribal woman, Hoikholhing Haokip, in crossfire between security forces and unidentified gunmen. The incident occurred during an operation launched after a farmer was shot.

title: ‘Operation Sindoor’ is proof new India will respond to terror with strength & strategy: Rajnath Singh
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh lauded 'Operation Sindoor' as a strong message to terrorists and their supporters, emphasizing India's firm stance against terrorism. He warned neighboring countries that India will respond decisively to any threats to its unity. Singh also urged army personnel to prioritize physical and mental well-being for national strength.

title: IND vs ENG: Shubman's coronation at Headingley - Gill steps into Virat Kohli's shoes with ton at No 4
content: Riding on the centuries from Yashasvi Jaiswal and captain Shubman Gill, India made a spectacular start to the Test series at Headingley, reaching 359/3 on Day 1. Yashasvi (101) and captain Shubman (127*) both scored centuries before Rishabh Pant’s unbeaten 65 supported the strong opening stand. England’s bowlers couldn’t penetrate the Indian top-order.

title: Won’t share Indus waters with other states: Omar Abdullah
content: Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah has strongly opposed the central government's proposal to divert Indus River waters to other states, asserting that J&K's needs must be prioritized. His statement comes after Amit Shah's announcement of a canal project to redirect surplus water to Rajasthan, Punjab, and Haryana.

title: Political parties seek home custody for separatist leader
content: Political leaders in Jammu and Kashmir are advocating for separatist leader Shabir Shah, who is reportedly battling prostate cancer and requires urgent surgery, to be placed under home custody.

title: Boston Bruins and NY Islanders eye blockbuster deal ahead of 2025 Draft
content: With the 2025 NHL Entry Draft just days away, a major trade could be brewing between the Boston Bruins and New York Islanders. League insiders report the Islanders want to acquire another top-10 pick, possibly targeting Long Island native James Hagens. The Bruins, holding the 7th pick, are reportedly exploring a roster-impacting trade package.

title: Pakistan army chief Asim Munir courts US opinion makers amid bid to reset strategic ties
content: Syed Asim Munir visited the United States. He met with scholars, experts, and media in Washington DC. Munir presented Pakistan's views on global issues. He emphasized regional stability and counter-terrorism efforts. Munir highlighted Pakistan's economic potential and sought investment. He advocated for a broader Pakistan-US partnership. Discussions aimed to build trust amid evolving US priorities.

title: MP Aga Ruhullah Mehdi talks of ‘accountability’, hints at growing rift with NC leadership
content: National Conference MP Aga Ruhullah Mehdi has openly expressed his discontent with the party's leadership, hinting at a potential independent path. Speaking in Sopore, he emphasized the need for accountability in J&K's political landscape and criticized the declining quality of politics.

title: ‘Cramps in both hands, but ...’: Jaiswal battles pain to hit hundred as India dominate England
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal's resilient century, despite suffering from hand cramps, and Shubman Gill's unbeaten ton as captain propelled India to a commanding position on Day 1 against England. Their strong partnerships, along with Rishabh Pant's aggressive knock, further solidified India's dominance. England's bowling coach acknowledged India's superior performance on the opening day.

title: Faridabad family kills daughter-in-law, hides her body in pit outside house
content: In Faridabad, a shocking incident unfolded where a woman, Tannu Kumar, was allegedly murdered and secretly buried by her in-laws. For two months, they concealed the crime by reporting her missing. Tannu's father, Hakim, suspected foul play upon seeing a freshly covered pit outside their house, but claims police initially ignored his concerns.

title: From 99 to 100! Yashasvi Jaiswal's century celebration leaves Vaibhav Suryavanshi starstruck - WATCH
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal displayed remarkable resilience, scoring a fighting century against England at Headingley despite battling hand cramps. The young Indian star's aggressive innings, featuring 16 boundaries and a six, propelled India forward. Jaiswal's hundred places him among an elite list of Indian batsmen with centuries in their maiden Test innings in England, before his innings was ended by Ben Stokes.

title: International Yoga Day 2025: 7 simple yoga poses to relieve cervical pain
content: International Yoga Day 2025 highlights yoga's role in holistic wellness, offering relief from modern ailments like cervical spondylosis. Specific asanas such as Cobra Pose and Cat Pose alleviate neck pain and stiffness by improving flexibility and strengthening supportive muscles. Consistent practice, combined with mindful habits, promotes long-term well-being and complements medical treatments.

title: Israel hammers Iran: Trump mulls bunker busters - will Xi rescue Ayatollah?
content: As tensions escalate between Israel and Iran, China remains cautious, offering rhetorical support but avoiding military intervention. Despite a strategic partnership and economic ties, Beijing prioritizes its own interests, including energy security and avoiding entanglement in a conflict with US-backed forces. China's approach reflects a broader strategy of non-interference and risk aversion in the Middle East.

title: 1st Test: Gill’s captaincy debut mirrors Kohli’s as India take control on Day 1
content: Shubman Gill's captaincy debut shone brightly as India dominated Day 1 against England, reaching 359/3. Gill's unbeaten 127 led the charge, supported by Yashasvi Jaiswal's century and Rishabh Pant's aggressive 65*. Despite Sai Sudharsan's debut duck, India's strong batting performance, especially the Gill-Jaiswal partnership, put them in a commanding position, marking their highest Day 1 score in England.

title: Op Sindhu: Iran lifts airspace ban to evacuate 1,000 Indians; 3 planes flying out
content: Iran has eased airspace restrictions to facilitate the evacuation of approximately 1,000 Indian nationals, primarily students, from Mashhad via charter flights. This follows relocation from Tehran after recent Israeli attacks. Operation Sindhu was launched by India to ensure the safe return of its citizens from Iran and Israel amidst escalating hostilities.

title: Kolkata Police detain Union Minister Sukanta Majumder from meeting ‘dissident’ British-Indian doctor
content: The BJP legislator said that the doctor had invited him to his house for tea, and accused the police of blocking him from approaching the doctor’s house, which was allegedly located next to the residence of Trinamool Congress MP Abhishek Banerjee

title: CBI arrests two from Kolkata for ₹183 crore fake bank guarantee fraud in M.P.
content: ‘The arrests exposed an inter-state gang involved in helping companies obtain fake bank guarantees to secure government projects in various States,’ the CBI said.

title: 21 officials suspended over ₹40-crore ‘farm scam’ in Maharashtra
content: According to officials, Out of the ₹80 crore received, ₹40 crore was misappropriated in Ambad and Ghansawangi tehsils

title: Sowing seeds of mistrust in Assam
content: The Muslim-majority district of Dhubri, in Assam, close to the Bangladesh border, has remained largely calm after experiencing some fraught periods following the demolition of the Babri Masjid in 1992. This month, however, cattle body parts were allegedly found at a Hanuman temple on successive days, sparking communal tensions. Rahul Karmakar reports on a district on edge

title: Operation Sindhu: 290 Indian students return from Iran, land in Delhi
content: Operation Sindhu evacuates Indian students from Iran amid conflict with Israel, with special Iranian cooperation and gratitude expressed

title: U.P. CM inaugurates 91.35 km long Gorakhpur Link Expressway
content: By prioritising infrastructure, Uttar Pradesh has shed the ‘BIMARU’ tag and emerged as an ‘emerging’ State, he adds

title: ‘City ready to execute ban on refuelling of overage vehicles’
content: ANPR cameras have been installed at all fuelling stations in city to help identify, deny fuel to overage vehicles from July 1, says CAQM; 4.90 lakh such vehicles identified through the tech already, it adds

title: Pressure of parents can deter schools to do exorbitant fee hike, says RSS education wing
content: Ravindra Kanhere emphasises parental pressure on schools to prevent exorbitant fee hikes, discusses education policies and Vidya Bharati’s expansion

title: Yogi inaugurates Gorakhpur Link Expressway, says U.P. is no longer a ‘BIMARU’ State
content: CM says the expressway will provide world-class connectivity to Azamgarh and the adjoining Sant Kabir Nagar, Ambedkar Nagar and Gorakhpur; accuses previous govt. of ‘failing in development’

title: Cognizant to invest $183 million for new India campus, add 8,000 jobs
content: Cognizant invests $182.76 million in new campus in Vishakapatanam, creating 8,000 jobs, with operations starting in 2029

title: Stray dog menace: three shelter homes to be set up in Kannur
content: Decision follows concern after a spate of dog bite incidents reported in the district. To prevent a potential rabies outbreak, stray dogs within the city limits will be captured, vaccinated, and relocated to the shelters

title: Use of banned food colours: safety squads intensify checks in Kozhikode
content: 5 regional squads are part of inspections, which will cover food-based ventures near schools, colleges, and other educational institutions

title: Ban on single-use plastic: food sector flags concerns
content: Kerala Hotel and Restaurants Association is planning to approach court seeking a practical solution to the issue

title: Demand to curb unchecked bamboo harvesting in Wayanad
content: Bamboo mafia smuggling tonnes of bamboo with support of Forest and panchayat officials, alleges forum

title: Hundreds of ICF-made coaches running in special trains to be withdrawn
content: With increasing number of complaints from the travelling public and railway officials in the recent months, the Railway Board has directed that erstwhile ICF-designed Garib Rath Express coaches be withdrawn from passenger service with immediate effect

title: Court permits U.K. fugitive’s extradition to face sexual assault charges
content: Wanted by authorities in Scotland for rape, sexual assault, and indecent communication involving three women, Mr. Paul came to India after charges were framed against him.

title: New India is assertive, resolute and will no longer be a victim of terrorism, says Rajnath in J&K
content: Operation Sindoor is not just a military action, it is a warning to terrorists sitting across the border, and more than that — to those who support them, says Defence Minister

title: Anand Sharma slams Piyush Goyal for calling ASEAN the B team of China
content: The Commerce Minister’s remarks were ‘irresponsible and insulting’, the former Commerce Minister said, pointing out that ASEAN is India’s fourth largest trading partner. He argued that the agreements with ASEAN were diligently negotiated considering India’s interests, and in-built checks and review mechanisms were put in place

title: Prof. Kodandaram of TJS urges Centre to stop Polavaram-Banakacherla link
content: BRS leader Harish Rao accuses Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy of having a tacit ‘pact’ with AP Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu on river waters issue

title: TTE returns bag containing valuables to passenger
content: He found the bag containing gold jewellery worth about ₹2 lakh and ₹37,000 cash in a coach of Gowthami Express

title: Calcutta High Court stays West Bengal government’s honorarium to Group C, D employees
content: The Supreme Court’s April 3 order had annulled the appointment of 25,752 employees, who included teachers and Group C and D employees in State-run schools

title: The AIADMK defends its role in Keeladi excavations, wants politics out of the issue
content: Deputy propaganda secretary K. Pandiarajan recalls that after the ASI decided not to pursue the Keeladi project further, Chief Minister Jayalalithaa stepped in. The State applied to the Centre for approval. The Central Advisory Board of Archaeology permitted the State to conduct excavations, which were done in stages. The reports were sent to the Union government

title: Karnataka’s major hydel reservoirs get double storage than last year due to early monsoon
content: The present storage can help generate 2,487 million units of power as against the level during the corresponding period last year which could have generated just 1,198 MU

title: Round-table meet demands transfer back of 5 villages from A.P. to Telangana
content: Telangana Jagruthi president Kavitha seeks taking up the issue at the PM’s meet with CMs of 4 States on June 25

title: Manipur districts tense after day of violence
content: A shutdown was observed in the Churachandpur district to protest the killing of a Kuki woman on Thursday

title: 8,583 students allotted seats in second phase free admissions in private schools in A.P.
content: Selected students to be informed through SMS, details also to be made available on website; action will be taken against schools if any student is denied admission without valid reasons, warns official

title: In special gesture, Iran opens its embattled airspace to allow flights carrying 1,000 Indians home
content: Acting envoy says India should join the world in condemning Israel’s “aggression”, warning that a failure to do so would “incentivise” others to attack their neighbours

title: Not happy with quality of polity in J&K: National Conference MP Ruhullah
content: His address to a civil society group in Sopore was not supported by local NC leaders, highlighting internal party tensions

title: ‘Chamayappura’ to demystify the art of make-up
content: Kerala Sangeetha Nataka Akademi’s national make-up workshop train 30 artists from across the country. Make-up artist Pattanam Rasheed will lead the workshop

title: Ready for discussions with A.P. on Bankacherla, but Centre’s step-motherly treatment towards Telangana not acceptable: Revanth
content: The urgency with which Centre responded after A.P. submitted the PFR is a concern, the Chief Minister pointed out stressing for a balanced approach in dealing with such sensitive inter-State issues

title: After a robust start, monsoon slips into lull phase
content: We expect a revival or another vigorous spell only by the end of the first week of July, says Neetha K. Gopal, IMD Director, Thiruvananthapuram

title: HMDA invites proposals for Land Pooling and Area Development, with an eye on investments
content: The consultant agency should identify at least 10 potential sites of around 5,000 acres each in consultation with HMDA based on the Master Plan, and prepare a concept report for each of these sites

title: Sharad Pawar signals MVA alliance for upcoming civic polls
content: Though formal discussions with the Congress are pending, we intend to explore a united front for the polls. A final decision will be taken soon, says NCP (SP) chief Sharad Pawar

title: Four leptospirosis deaths in two months; Thrissur on high alert
content: As many as 21 confirmed cases have been reported, with 26 people showing symptoms and seeking treatment in the past one and a half months

title: Kerala Sasthra Sahithya Parishath opposes plan to introduce uniform Kerala Studies course
content: KSSP says such a stance could undermine the academic autonomy and restrict the ability of universities to reflect regional, cultural and historical diversity of their syllabi.

title: Block panchayats to form ‘de-addiction anonymous’ groups to fight drug menace
content: Training programmes are also proposed for residents’ association representatives to involve them in anti-drug campaigns.

title: Kerala’s internal revenue generation tipped to cross ₹1 lakh crore in 2025-26, says Finance Minister
content: Balagopal says State finances will continue in recovery mode despite severe challenges on the fiscal front. The estimated growth is the outcome of improved efficiency in tax collection enabled by a comprehensive overhaul of the Taxes department in GST regime

title: Extract public commitment from Modi on continuing VSP in the public sector, CPI(M) tells Naidu, Pawan
content: People have been misled in the name of a revival package, and many employees have already lost their jobs, says party State secretary Srinivasa Rao; he also finds fault with the government spending ₹70 crore on Yogandhra programme

title: International Yoga Day Today, PM Modi Attends Mega Event At Visakhapatnam
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will participate in the International Yoga Day celebrations in Visakhapatnam on Saturday and the Andhra Pradesh government is pulling out all stops to ensure that the event is a grand one.

title: Live: PM Modi To Lead Mega Yoga Day Celebrations In Visakhapatnam Shortly
content: The 11th International Yoga Day is being celebrated across the world on the Morning of 21st June with the theme of "Yoga for One Earth, One Health".

title: US Court Orders Release Of Pro-Palestinian Activist Mahmoud Khalil
content: A U.S. judge ordered on Friday that Columbia University graduate Mahmoud Khalil be released from custody, a major victory for rights groups that challenged what they called the Trump administration's unlawful targeting of a pro-Palestinian activist.

title: "She's Wrong": Trump On Spy Chief Tulsi Gabbard's Iran Nuclear Remark
content: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday that his Director of National Intelligence, Tulsi Gabbard, was wrong in suggesting there was no evidence Iran is building a nuclear weapon.

title: Trump Says He May Support Israel-Iran Ceasefire "Depending On Circumstances"
content: President Donald Trump said on Friday he might support a ceasefire in the week-old aerial conflict between U.S. ally Israel and its regional rival Iran "depending on the circumstances".

title: Two Arrested In Rs 183 Crore Fake Bank Guarantee Scam
content: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) initiated three distinct cases on May 9, in accordance with directives issued by the High Court of Madhya Pradesh, the agency said in a release on Thursday.

title: Congress Favours Hindi, But English Opens New Avenues: Ashok Gehlot
content: Former Rajasthan chief minister Ashok Gehlot on Friday said Congress is in favour of Hindi but English opens new avenues in the world for everyone.

title: Over 650 Iranian Military Personnel, Civilians Killed In Israeli Strikes
content: A US-based NGO said Friday that Israel's strikes against Iran have killed at least 657 people including civilians and members of the security forces, a toll based on sources and reports in Iran.

title: Russia Advancing Long-Term Economic Ties With India, Key Partners: Putin
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday said Moscow's action plan for long-term cooperation till 2030 with India should be finalised shortly.

title: Flyer Smuggles In 2 Monkeys, 7 Tortoises From Bangkok, Caught In Chennai
content: An Indian man returning from Bangkok was caught carrying two live monkeys of different species in ventilated carry bags and seven tortoises in a cloth bag at the Chennai airport.

title: Mumbai Man Charged For Sexually Exploiting Doctor From Dating App, Forcing Abortion
content: A man was charged for allegedly sexually exploiting a doctor he met on a dating app, forcing her to undergo an abortion and also threatening to circulate her private photographs on social media, a Mumbai police officer said on Friday.

title: PM Modi To Lead 11th Yoga Day Celebrations In Visakhapatnam Today
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived in Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam on Friday evening to lead the national event as part of the 11th International Yoga Day celebrations on Saturday.

title: Iran Opens Airspace For India, 1st Batch Of Students To Reach Delhi Tonight
content: Iran has opened its otherwise closed airspace exclusively for Indian evacuation flights. At least 1,000 Indian students stranded in conflict-hit Iranian cities are expected to land in Delhi in the next two days as part of the government's emergency

title: Archaeological Body To Host Yoga Event At 81 Historic Sites, Entry Free For All
content: On the occasion of International Day of Yoga on Friday (June 21), the Archaeological Survey of India, in collaboration with the Ministry of Ayush, is set to host Yoga Sessions across 81 centrally protected monuments.

title: Israel-Iran Conflict: How 'Cluster Bomb' Works, Why It's Controversial
content: Israel has alleged that Iran fired a missile with cluster bomb warhead on a civilian area. The missile started releasing the bomblets at an altitude of 23,000 feet (7 km). The Iranian missile scattered at least 20 bomblets across a radius of 8 km.

title: How Villagers In Telangana Averted Nearly 300 Deaths By Suicide
content: The residents of Yamcha in Nizamabad district of Telangana are good Samaritans in the true sense of the term, as their efforts saved about 300 people from committing suicide by jumping off a bridge on the river Godavari near their village.

title: France's Macron Says Europe To Push Peace Plan To End Iran-Israel Conflict
content: The proposal marks one of the most expansive peace efforts by Europe in recent years, addressing not just Iran's nuclear ambitions but also the broader spectrum of regional instability linked to Tehran.

title: 'Flying On A Dreamliner? I'm On': Ex Aviation Minister Praful Patel After Crash
content: There is no cause for worry after the Air India crash in Ahmedabad and the country's regulatory framework is strong, former civil aviation minister Praful Patel has said.

title: Over 11,000 Navy Personnel, Their Families To Join Yoga Day Event In Andhra
content: Over 11,000 naval personnel and their family members from the Navy's Eastern Naval Command would be participating in the grand Yoga Day celebrations in Visakhapatnam that will be led by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday.

title: Will Provide Security To Farmers In Vulnerable Areas: Manipur Government
content: A woman was killed and a farmer shot at in separate incidents in Manipur's Churachandpur and Bishnupur districts, respectively, on Thursday.

title: Transfer window weekly: Napoli chase Núñez; Chelsea eye Joâo Pedro
content: the club world cup transfer window has closed . but the club's main window is open with the rest of Europe to follow on July 1 . sportsmail's reporters hearing about possible deals every Friday until September . 'the anfield wrap' is looking at which Premier League games Liverpool might have after Champions League knockout games .

title: Middle East crisis: Iranians speak out amid relentless bombings
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, providing a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers .

title: Expert picks, best bets for UFC Fight Night and PFL semifinals
content: light heavyweights jamahal Hill and Khalil Rountree will clash in the main event . MMA veteran and former UFC fighter Kevin Lee will make his PFL debut against Gadzhi Rabadanov . former Bellator champion Liz Carmouche takes on Elora Dana .

title: Sources: Galatasaray monitoring City's Gündogan
content: Ilkay Gündogan is under contract at manchester city until 2026 . the 34-year-old is part of pep Guardiola's squad in the united states for the FIFA Club World Cup . there is extra competition for places in midfield following the arrival of Tijjani Reijnders and Rodri 's return from injury'

title: Liverpool sign Germany's Wirtz in club-record deal
content: german international Florian Wirtz signs a five-year deal with the premier league champions . the deal is worth a total of £116 million ($156.27 million) a source says the deal includes an initial £100 million payment with £16 million in add-ons to the deal . wirtz says he wants to have something completely new to go out of the Bundesliga .

title: 2025 AAC preview: Can Army and Navy throw off the balance of power again?
content: both programs had slipped in recent years; blocking rule changes targeted cut-blocking common with service-academy option attacks . this time last year, you could pretty easily paint a picture of college football leaving both programs behind .

title: From crowd-surfing with the Stanley Cup to Dairy Queen: Inside Brad Marchand's post-title tour
content: it's been 14 years since Brad Marchand last had the chance to party with the Stanley Cup . he's older and wiser -- in the sense that he won't be getting a misspelled tattoo . but the man still knows how to celebrate a championship .

title: Ranking the 10 most unbreakable records in college football
content: college football has evolved greatly over the years, but there are some records and accomplishments that have stood the test of time . we've examined the past 75 years in college football, tracing back to the 1950 season, and have ranked the 10 most "unbreakable" records in the sport, listing them in order of least likely to be topped.

title: 2025 NBA Finals: Pacers dominate at home in Game 6
content: the Pacers are able to force a game 7 of the NBA Finals . the Thunder were down 8-2 in the first game of the season . they missed their opening six shots, a streak that eventually grew to eight . a timeout was a precursor of an onslaught .

title: Why there's a 30-foot, 15K-pound fiberglass tiger circling the Men's College World Series
content: a version of this story ran before the semifinal round of the men's college world series . it has been updated to reflect LSU advancing the championship series against Coastal Carolina . "LSU Pregame" was the first song, and Greene's uncle, Jacob Stone, steered the 15,000-pound fiberglass tiger around traffic .

title: 🤝 NBA draft trades: 5 deals to shake up first round

title: Is the Club World Cup important? Yes, just ask the South American teams
